message: “Here’s how it works: kids (students) see a sign on the side of the road that says, ‘make $750 a week traveling the country’ and they call the 1-800 number, and they think they’re going to travel the United States with kids their age, see America or go to the beach, and while they’re out, they’re going to sell some magazines,”

data.description: BUCKHANNON — Local law enforcement spent Wednesday learning why West Virginia is particularly vulnerable to a crime that all too often goes under the radar — human trafficking.
data.title: Local police learn how to spot human trafficking
